text: William Kirk English (January 27, 1929 â€“ July 26, 2020) was an American computer engineer. He was known for helping create the computer mouse while working for Douglas Engelbart at SRI International's Augmentation Research Center. He would later work for Xerox PARC and Sun Microsystems. English died of respiratory failure in San Rafael, California on July 26, 2020, aged 91. ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American computer engineers Category:People from Lexington, Kentucky Category:Scientists from Kentucky
title: Bill English (computer engineer)
